intro: Ardisia vigoi, commonly known as the Brazilian peppertree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces bright red, berry-like fruits that are toxic to humans and animals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its invasive nature in some regions, it is considered a problematic species in ecological contexts.
